page.title: 10 Housing.
page.content: There are still a number of traditional cottages in and around the village. These have cob walls with thatched roofs. In some cases cottages have been combined to make a larger dwelling, extensions have been added and some have been converted into detached garages. There are a few cob cottages where the thatch was replaced by slate during the nineteenth century. There are a few houses from the period between the wars and these are all brick and tile. There has been a lot of building during the last thirty years, mostly bungalows. There is a small estate of council houses and other council houses are spread around the village. Many farm workers cottages have been sold or are occupied by tenants who are not agricultural workers.
